intro: Zosterophyllanthos arctatus, commonly known as the Arctic zosterophyll, is a rare and specialized plant found in extreme northern environments. It belongs to the family Zosterophyllaceae and is characterized by its unique, filamentous structure adapted to cold and nutrient-poor conditions. The plant exhibits a low-growing, mat-forming habit, which helps it conserve heat and moisture in its harsh habitat. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. Zosterophyllanthos arctatus plays a crucial role in stabilizing soil and supporting microbial life in Arctic ecosystems.
